Comments_List: I advanced my knowledge of Spanish in speaking, writing, and reading.
I strengthened my knowledge of previous Spanish grammar skills taught in L2 and supplemented this knowledge with additional cultural readings and media.
I think this course and well organized and I don't have any suggestions for improvements.

The course is organized in a way that really helps improve the level of spanish of the students quickly. However, I found that some of the readings in this course were way above our level and often had specialized vocabulary so that I would have to look up many words.

I thoroughly enjoyed the readings and videos that brightened up the class. The professors were really helpful with accommodating questions about tricky grammatical concepts that were difficult for the students.
Yes, this course is nicely structured to facilitate Spanish language learning. If you're interested in learning the language, this is the best way to do it.

Yes. If you feel a bit fuzzy on past grammar structures or concepts or just simply want to expand your Spanish vocabulary, it's a helpful course to take. Be warned, however, that the class moves rapidlyyou need to be on top of yourself and hold yourself accountable.
